snippet: Every few blocks throughout Midtown and Lower Manhattan, and in parts of Brooklyn and Queens, New Yorkers will have access to a new alternative for public travel.
abstract: New York City releases map of the proposed locations for its new bike-sharing program, which will make 10,000 bicycles available for rent to New Yorkers who sign up for short-term or long-term memberships.
lead_paragraph: Every few blocks throughout Midtown and Lower Manhattan, and in parts of Brooklyn and Queens, New Yorkers will have access to a new alternative for public travel.

headline.seo: Locations of Bike-Share Stations Unveiled by City
headline.main: City Unveils Locations of Bike-Share Stations
headline.print_headline: City Unveils Locations of Bike-Share Stations
